DataElement.preferredName: Throat Mucosa Endoscopic Visualization Abnormal or Suspicious Finding Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not an abnormal or suspicious lesion was found on endoscopic visualization of the throat muscosal site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Throat Mucosa Endoscopic Procedure Visual Abnormal Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth._Mucous membrane._A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues._Relating to or using sight; able to be seen._Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth.:Mucous membrane.

Concepts.definition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.:Relating to or using sight; able to be seen.:Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.
Relating to or using sight; able to be seen.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret study in Rave. mc 11/7/2016

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves
